intro: Fimbristemma warscewiczii, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and has been used traditionally for various purposes. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in savanna regions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
